verses.roman:
uvāsa katicin māsān
gopīnāṁ vinudan śucaḥ
kṛṣṇa-līlā-kathāṁ gāyan
ramayām āsa gokulam

synonyms: uvāsa—he resided; katicit—for some; māsān—months; gopīnām—of the cowherd girls; vinudan—dispelling; śucaḥ—the unhappiness; kṛṣṇa-līlā—of the pastimes of Lord Kṛṣṇa; kathām—the topics; gāyan—singing; ramayām āsa—he gave joy; gokulam—to Gokula.
translation: Uddhava remained there for several months, dispelling the gopīs' sorrow by chanting the topics of Lord Kṛṣṇa's pastimes. Thus he brought joy to all the people of Gokula.

purport.content: The great ācārya Jīva Gosvāmī comments in this regard that Uddhava, during his stay in Vṛndāvana, certainly took special care to enliven Kṛṣṇa's foster parents, Nanda and Yaśodā.
